title: Michael Sheen 'gave OBE back' to air views on the monarchy
description: The Hollywood actor said his 2009 honour was relinquished as did not want to be a "hypocrite".

title: Students design 'Mitt' prosthetic limb for children
description: Some devices can be too heavy for children, so a group of Imperial College students designed a new, lighter one.

title: Positive Covid-19 tests at Fulham put game at Tottenham in doubt
description: Fulham's Premier League match at Tottenham on Wednesday is in doubt because of new coronavirus cases at the club.

title: Racism in the military? A former RAF officer's story
description: One former RAF officer says his concerns about racism in the military were never properly addressed.

title: Brexit vote: Starmer faces Labour revolt over backing for deal
description: Senior Labour figures urge the party not to vote for Boris Johnson's "rotten" agreement on Wednesday.

title: Pierre Cardin: French fashion giant dies aged 98
description: He helped revolutionise fashion with his futuristic and stylish designs in the 1950s and 60s.

title: Covid: UK faces 'catastrophe' without tougher action, warns scientist
description: Hospitals in the UK are coming under increasing pressure amid a rising number of coronavirus cases.

title: Covid: Sydney beach party sparks 'backpacker' deportation threat
description: Australian minister says temporary visa holders who flout coronavirus restrictions could be deported.

title: Pierre Cardin: Designer who was 'one step ahead of tomorrow'
description: The legendary French fashion designer will be remembered for his futuristic designs and huge range.

title: Covid-19: Military back-up for pupil testing programme
description: But teaching unions say there is still not enough time to get tests up and running in England's schools.

title: Giving up Christmas, grief and Garcia's first big test - Campbell on his big-fight sacrifice
description: As he prepares to face Ryan Garcia, Luke Campbell discusses writing off Christmas, social media, grief and world title pursuits.

title: Covid: Lockdown visits to Brecon Beacons 'disappointing'
description: An intensive care consultant and a council boss have said crowds gathering is against the rules

title: Ratatouille musical: Stars join show that was cooked up on TikTok
description: Adam Lambert and Tituss Burgess lead the cast for a show that was cooked up by fans on TikTok.

title: Biden accuses US defence department of obstruction on transition
description: The president-elect says his team is not getting the information it needs on national security.

title: PSG sack Tuchel and line up Pochettino
description: Former Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino is the main contender to take over at Paris St-Germain after Thomas Tuchel's sacking.

title: Keyon Harrold: Jazz trumpeter says son assaulted after false theft accusation
description: Jazz trumpeter Keyon Harrold says the incident happened after a woman falsely accused his son of theft.

title: Green body gives verdict on Boris Johnson carbon-cutting policies
description: The Green Alliance says there is gap between the PM's plans and what is needed to meet carbon targets.

title: 'One of the great comebacks' - India thrash Australia to level series
description: India beat Australia by eight wickets with a day to spare in the second Test in Melbourne to level the four-match series.

title: Athletic Bilbao v Real Sociedad: How La Real's trust in youth is paying off
description: Real Sociedad visit Athletic Bilbao in the Basque derby on Thursday looking to reignite their La Liga title challenge.

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Spring it on!' and 'don't betray our children'
description: The papers report details of the Covid vaccine roll out and fears schools may be closed until February.

title: Parents warned of 'sharp rise' in eating disorders
description: Child health leaders say the increase is partly down to the pandemic's impact on young people.

title: Covid, furlough and Topshop collapse: 2020 in business stories
description: Which BBC Business stories were the most widely read in the year the coronavirus pandemic spread?

title: Pregnant at 13 and able to attend school
description: Sierra Leone lifted its ban on pregnant girls attending school this year. Will Tanzania do the same?

title: Seeking justice for Lion Sleeps Tonight composer
description: A music producer remixes an old classic to correct some injustices of the past.

title: India coronavirus: The tragedy of the tuk-tuk driver who fled Covid
description: Rajan Yadav is one of millions of migrant workers whose lives were destroyed by India's lockdown.

title: 2020 and me: 'Be grateful for what you've got'
description: Vicky tells the BBC how, like many others, her world suddenly changed when London went into lockdown.

title: 'If that's darts, I'm offski' - Anderson fuming despite beating Suljovic
description: Two-time PDC world champion Gary Anderson said darts fans would have been better off watching Coronation Street than his 4-3 third-round win over Mensur Suljovic.

title: Coronavirus: Spain to keep register of those who refuse Covid vaccine
description: Vaccination will not be mandatory, officials say, and the register will not be made public.

title: China Covid-19: How state media and censorship took on coronavirus
description: We look back at how China's propaganda and censorship machine responded during a particularly dramatic year.

title: When Greta Thunberg met Margaret Atwood... on Zoom
description: The teenage climate activist and veteran author and environmentalist were brought together by Radio 4's Today Programme.

title: Covid in prison: 'We should be treated like humans'
description: Reports suggest one-in-five prisoners have tested positive for Covid in the US, and 1,700 have died.

title: The big tech questions for 2021
description: After a year that saw tech companies prosper, we look ahead to what the coming 12 months could bring.

title: Zoom: All the times virtual meetings didn't go as planned this year
description: From animal interruptions to catching fire, here's a look back at the year we spent (badly) online.
